what:
Multiplicity of infection in Mali using 24-SNP barcode data (Adomako-Ankomah
 et al., 2017) — Adomako_Ankomah_2017
title:
Multiplicity of infection in Mali using 24-SNP barcode data (Adomako-Ankomah
 et al., 2017) — Adomako_Ankomah_2017
text: Data Adomako-Ankomah et al. (2017). give brief summary data - see original paper full details.  longitudinal cohort study conducted seasonal high-transmission area Mali, 500 subjects aged 1–65 years followed 1 year. Blood samples collected every 2 weeks. Multiclonality Pf infection measured using 24-SNP DNA barcoding assay 4 time-points (two wet season, two dry season).

what: 24-SNP barcode data from two urban cities in Nigeria (Bankole et al., 2018) — Bankole_2018
title: 24-SNP barcode data from two urban cities in Nigeria (Bankole et al., 2018) — Bankole_2018
text: Data Bankole et al. (2018). give brief summary data - see original paper full details.  Samples obtained two major urban cities, Ibadan Enugu Nigeria, high transmission settings. DNA extracted dried blood impregnated filter paper samples genotyped using 24-SNP barcode. Samples considered polygenomic 2 heterozygous sites (Enugu = 5/28, Ibadan = 5/37), monogenomic otherwise.  Data extracted using Tabula v1.2.1.

what: 24-SNP barcode data at two time-points in Senegal (Bei et al., 2018) — Bei_2018
title: 24-SNP barcode data at two time-points in Senegal (Bei et al., 2018) — Bei_2018
text: Data Bei et al. (2018). give brief summary data - see original paper full details.  Samples randomly selected longitudinal cohorts collected Dielmo/Ndiop, Senegal, focus 2 distant time-points (2001-2002, 2014). first time-point corresponds period high transmission, second period extremely low transmission. Samples genotyped using 24-SNP barcode, complexity infection estimated using COIL algorithm. Samples also matched large database previously published unpublished barcodes. samples low transmission period (2014), one three repeated barcode clusters (n = 6) corresponded parasite type (haplotype 3), observed Thiès 2007 2010. 2 clusters (IP1, n = 2; IP2, n = 2) previously observed. Data extracted using Tabula v1.2.1.

title: 24-SNP barcode data at two time-points in Senegal (Bei et al., 2018) — Bei_2018
24-SNP barcode data at two time-points in Senegal (Bei et al., 2018) — Bei_2018
text: list multiple data objects: EIR: estimates EIR location year barcodes: genetic data associated sample characteristics SNP_locations: genomic locations SNPs (key used barcodes) EIR: dataframe 3 columns, giving time, sampling   location, estimated EIR (see original paper details). EIR   2014 Ndiop recorded "0.0" paper, coded   "<0.05" indicate precision estimate. barcodes: dataframe 34 columns. Gives sample characteristics   (columns 1:7), estimated COI whether indicates   monogenomic/polygenomic infection (columns 8:9), individual SNPs   (columns 10:33) corresponding haplotype, known (column 34). SNP_locations: dataframe acts key relating SNP codes   present barcodes corresponding genomic location.

(2021). give brief summary data - see original paper full details.  study uses 80 randomly sampled households around single health facility includes children (6 mo - 10 years old) least one adult caretaker households. what: SNP data collected from Uganda (Chang et al., 2017) — Chang_2017
title: SNP data collected from Uganda (Chang et al., 2017) — Chang_2017
text: Data Chang et al. (2017). give brief summary data - see original paper full details.  Dried blood spots taken 2012-13 cross sectional surveys several provinces Uganda. Households (n = 200) randomly selected province. samples detectable asexual parasitemia selected Sequenom SNP genotyping. Medium high frequency SNPs (n = 128) high frequency malaria populations (pf-community-project) chosen, leaving 105 SNPs filtering variants lower missing frequencies. Genotyping based intensity SNPs. addition, merozoite surface protein 2 (msp2) genotyping conducted age stratified subset samples. Capillary electrophoresis used distinguish msp2 allele sizes.  data contains list (size = 3) data frames. first data frame contains SNP calls 105 filtered SNPs. values {-1, 0, 0.5, 1} denote missing value / call, heterozygous, homozygous alleles. second third data frame contain 95 frequencies using described categorical proportional methods modeling homozygous/heterozygous calls -host allele frequency, respectively.

title: SNP data collected from Uganda (Chang et al., 2017) — Chang_2017
SNP data collected from Uganda (Chang et al., 2017) — Chang_2017
text: list multiple data objects S1_Table_SNP_data: SNP calls sample {-1, 0, 0.5, 1}. 95_cred_interval_coi: Calculated COI Uganda Samples     using categorical proportional methods described paper. 95_cred_interval_allele_freq: Calculated allele frequency     Uganda Samples using categorical proportional methods described     paper. S1_Table_SNP_data: data frame 107 columns. sample id   location included first 2 columns. SNP calls (columns 3:107)   either call / missing data (-1), heterozygous (0.5) homozygous (0   1). S2_Table_95_cred_int_coi_uganda_samples: data frame 15 columns   containing calculated complexity infection summary statistics  categorical, proportional, COIL methods. S3_Table_95_cred_int_allele_freq: data frame 25 columns  containing summary statistics allele frequency categorical,   proportional, COIL methods.

what:
24-SNP barcode data showing population structure in Haiti (Charles et al.,
2016) — Charles_2016
title:
24-SNP barcode data showing population structure in Haiti (Charles et al.,
2016) — Charles_2016
text: Data Charles et al. (2016). give brief summary data - see original paper full details.  Samples collected routine surveillance spanning 2006–2009 Haitian Group Study Kaposi’s Sarcoma Opportunistic Infections (GHESKIO) 9 healthcare centers various municipalities. Samples genotyped using 24-SNP barcode. paper states samples showed >1 mixed-base SNP call >5 missing calls 24SNP molecular barcode removed analysis, however, 1 sample (monogenomic sample 24) 6 missing calls removed, also 1 sample (polygenomic sample 8) exactly 1 mixed-base SNP call 0 missing calls yet removed. Therefore, possible samples removed showed >0 mixed-base calls, >6 missing calls (data presented consistent filtering). monogenomic (n = 52) polygenomic (n = 8) samples available, although samples excluded based missingness available. Samples compared terms proportion shared bases, identified either identical, related, unique based number.

what:
24-SNP barcode data showing clonal and epidemic transmission in Senegal
(Daniels et al., 2013) — Daniels_2013
title:
24-SNP barcode data showing clonal and epidemic transmission in Senegal
(Daniels et al., 2013) — Daniels_2013
text: Data Daniels et al. (2013). give brief summary data - see original paper full details.  Note - see ?Galinsky_2015 expanded version set barcodes. 529 Sample IDs dataset also present Galinsky_2015, along additional 445 samples.  Samples obtained annually 2006–2011 Service de Lutte Anti-Parasitaire (SLAP) clinic Thies, Senegal. Samples collected passively; patients age 12 months admitted study self-reported acute fevers within 24 hours visiting clinic recent anti-malarial use. Whole blood spots 2006–2011 preserved filter paper, DNA extracted characterised using 24-SNP molecular barcode. Samples excluded missing data four SNP positions. Samples identified polygenomic multiallelic calls one SNP position, otherwise monogenomic. unclear whether data presented monogenomic samples , one sample (SenT081) mixed calls 2 sites therefore polygenomic, seems unlikely one polygenomic sample observed entire dataset.

what: 24-SNP barcode data from 11 sentinel sites in Haiti (Daniels et al., 2020) — Daniels_2020
title: 24-SNP barcode data from 11 sentinel sites in Haiti (Daniels et al., 2020) — Daniels_2020
text: Data Daniels et al. (2020). give brief summary data - see original paper full details.  Sample sites Haiti included four sentinel sites three departments (Grand’Anse, Sud, Nippes) among 11 sites nationwide established anti-malarial molecular resistance marker surveillance. Individuals ages seeking treatment clinics located sentinel sites symptoms malaria also tested positive malaria either microscopy rapid diagnostic test (RDT) March 2016 December 2017 considered eligible participate. Interviews also conducted collect patient information (including age, gender, recent travel history). Genomic DNA isolated dried blood spots genotyped using 24-SNP barcode. Samples designated polygenomic multiple alleles observed two positions. quality filtering stages, remained 42 polygenomic samples 462 monogenomic samples.

what: 24-SNP barcode data from two trials in Zambia (Daniels et al., 2020) — Daniels_2020B
title: 24-SNP barcode data from two trials in Zambia (Daniels et al., 2020) — Daniels_2020B
text: Data Daniels et al. (2020). give brief summary data - see original paper full details.  Rapid diagnostic test-positive samples obtained household-level data collection two community-randomized trials conducted geographical region Southern Province Zambia 2012 2016. first sample set (n = 836 children younger 6 years) collected peak malaria transmission season (April–May) 2012 2013 (baseline) part community-randomized controlled trial designed assess impact three rounds MTAT intervention used RDTs testing artemether–lumefantrine treatment. second sample set (n = 784 individuals 3 months older) obtained 18-month longitudinal cohort study, monthly follow-visits, conducted December 2014 May 2016 (cohort). cohort designed evaluate cluster randomized controlled trial assessing impact four rounds community-wide MDA household-level (focal) MDA (fMDA) DHAp compared mass treatment (control).  Samples genotyped using 24-SNP barcode. Samples designated polygenomic multiple alleles observed two positions, otherwise designated monogenomic. Samples missing data 5 loci deemed "failed" purposes subsequent analyses, included data anyway.

title: 24-SNP barcode data from two trials in Zambia (Daniels et al., 2020) — Daniels_2020B
24-SNP barcode data from two trials in Zambia (Daniels et al., 2020) — Daniels_2020B
text: dataframe 34 columns, giving sample ID, collection date,   study type, (TODO), study batch arm (columns 1:6), genomic data   24 SNPs (columns 7:30), details missingness designated   mono/polyclonality (columns 31:34). Heterozygous genotyping calls   identified "N", missing alleles identified "X". Note,   original downloaded data contained 18 samples missing genotypic data,   removed leave 1620 samples referred main   paper.

title: 24-SNP barcode data from Richard Toll, Senegal (Daniels et al., 2020) — Daniels_2020C
text: Data Daniels et al. (2020). give brief summary data - see original paper full details.  Samples obtained routine case investigation carried Richard Toll, Senegal September 2012 December 2015. Rapid diagnostic tests (RDTs) used diagnose malaria cases either facility-based passive case detection (PCD) reactive case detection (RACD). standardized questionnaire also filled participants collect information basic demographic information including travel history. RDTs used genotype malaria infections using 24-SNP barcode. Samples designated polygenomic multiple alleles observed two positions, otherwise designated monogenomic. Samples missing data 5 loci deemed "failed" purposes subsequent analyses, included data anyway.

(2015). give brief summary data - see original paper full details.  study focused 37 P. falciparum isolates collected 2003–2008 individuals malaria-endemic provinces eastern Panama, along 20 isolates collected 2011–2012 healthcare facilities 3 malaria endemic sites Colombia. text: Data Roh et al. (2019). give brief summary data - see original paper full details.  study investigates local versus imported transmissions effects genetic diversity Eswatini. parameters collected epidemiological model include district residence, season, case detection, age, sex, patient occupation. compare genetic diversity,  overlapping subset microsatellite markers used compare countries lower transmission rates (found Eswatini greater diversity parasites (mean $H_E$ consistently higher)). comparing local imported cases, population level diversity differentiate greatly; however, greater portion local cases monoclonal less complex. Differences MOI $F_ws$ cases statistically significant marginal effect sizes used discriminate cases.   Eligible cases identified Eswatini's national malaria surveillance program. Samples genotyped using microsatellites 26 different loci, showed selection based $F_ws$ calculations. study, excluded data points probability allele less 95

title: Load system file — SIMPLEGEN
text: Forwards-time simulation Plasmodium falciparum genetic   data can computationally intensive, many genotypes tracked   ultimately lost. SIMPLEGEN avoids problem splitting simulation   three steps - first, simulating transmission simple   individual-based model, second, pruning infection history focus   nodes contribute final sample, third, simulating genetic   data. secondary advantage third-party epidemiological   simulator can used first step long outputs   correct format. major limitation SIMPLEGEN assumes   epidemiological genetic processes seperable, hence limited   neutral variation, model selection.

what: 93-SNP barcode data from Thai-Myanmar border (Taylor et al., 2017) — Taylor_2017
title: 93-SNP barcode data from Thai-Myanmar border (Taylor et al., 2017) — Taylor_2017
text: Data Taylor et al. (2017). give brief summary data - see original paper full details.  Samples obtained Shoklo Malaria Research Unit (SMRU) clinics spanning approximately 120km border Thailand Myanmar, collected 2001-2014. 1731 samples genotyped using 93-SNP barcode. Samples 6 heteroallelic genotyping outcomes designated multiple infections (n = 558), samples denoted single infections (n = 1173).

what: 250-SNP barcode reveals connectivity on Colombian-Pacific coast (Taylor et al., 2020) — Taylor_2020
title: 250-SNP barcode reveals connectivity on Colombian-Pacific coast (Taylor et al., 2020) — Taylor_2020
text: Data Taylor et al. (2020). give brief summary data - see original paper full details.  study Taylor et al. (2020) uses data previously published study Echeverry et al. (2013). Samples obtained patients symptomatic uncomplicated malaria, collected 1993 2007 five cities four provinces Colombia. Samples genotyped using 250-SNP barcode. samples considered monoclonal infections, therefore heterozygous genotype calls recoded missing data. Note markers re-ordered post-publication, qualitatively alter major conclusions (see Github README).

title: 250-SNP barcode reveals connectivity on Colombian-Pacific coast (Taylor et al., 2020) — Taylor_2020
250-SNP barcode reveals connectivity on Colombian-Pacific coast (Taylor et al., 2020) — Taylor_2020
text: dataframe 257 columns, giving sample ID (column 1),   multi-locus genotype ID (column 2), collection place time (columns   3:5), genotype call 250 SNPs (columns 6:255), number   heterozygous loci original data (now recoded missing) (column   256) collection year (column 257, matches info column 5).   Genotype values give 0 minor allele, 1 major allele, NA   missing data. Samples considered monoclonal therefore   heterozygous calls recoded missing data.

ISSN 1471-2156, doi: 10.1186/1471-2156-14-2 , 2022-04-27.

(2019). give brief summary data - see original paper full details.  study collected samples 4643 symptomatic outpatients northeast Namibia (Kavango East Zambezi) confirmed cases via rapid tests. 3871 cases Kavango East (March-June 2016) 23 different health facilities, 772 Zambezi (Feb 2015 June 2016) six facilities.  DNA extracted dried blood spots using punches strips rapid  diagnostic tests. facility less 100 rapid tests, tests included genotyping. 100 tests, cases travel history included genotyping, 100 cases without history also included. total, 2990 samples genotyped using microsatellite markers, 2585 used data analysis.

what: Define parameters of transmission simulation model — define_epi_model_parameters
title: Define parameters of transmission simulation model — define_epi_model_parameters
text: Define parameters used simulating data  inbuilt SIMPLEGEN transmission model.

title: Define parameters of transmission simulation model — define_epi_model_parameters
code: define_epi_model_parameters(   project,   a = 0.3,   p = 0.868,   mu = -log(p),   u = 12,   v = 10,   g = 12,   prob_infection = 0.5,   prob_acute = 1,   prob_AC = 1,   duration_acute = dgeom(1:25, 1/5),   duration_chronic = dgeom(1:1000, 1/200),   detectability_microscopy_acute = 0.8,   detectability_microscopy_chronic = 0.2,   detectability_PCR_acute = 1,   detectability_PCR_chronic = 0.8,   time_treatment_acute = dgeom(1:25, 1/5),   time_treatment_chronic = dgeom(1:100, 1/20),   treatment_seeking_mean = 0.5,   treatment_seeking_sd = 0.1,   duration_prophylactic = dgeom(1:25, 1/5),   infectivity_acute = 0.115,   infectivity_chronic = 0.078,   max_inoculations = 5,   H = 1000,   seed_infections = 100,   M = 1000,   mig_mat = diag(1),   life_table = life_table_Mali() )

title: Define parameters of transmission simulation model — define_epi_model_parameters
text: project SIMPLEGEN project, produced simplegen_project() function. human blood feeding rate. proportion mosquitoes feed humans day. p mosquito probability surviving one day. mu mosquito instantaneous death rate. mu = -log(p) unless specified otherwise. u intrinsic incubation period. number days initial inoculation blood-stage infection human host. v extrinsic incubation period. number days initial inoculation becoming infectious mosquito. g lag time human blood-stage infection production gametocytes. prob_infection probability human becomes infected bitten infected mosquito. vector, subsequent value applies subsequent infectious bite. prob_acute probability infection passes acute stage rather going directly chronic stage. vector, subsequent value applies subsequent infection. prob_AC probability infection acute stage passes chronic stage rather recovering directly. vector, subsequent value applies subsequent infection. duration_acute, duration_chronic specifies probability distribution duration (days) acute chronic disease. Can vector list. list first element specifies probability distribution first incident disease, second element second incident (final element used remaining incidents). single vector probability distribution used incidents disease. Values automatically normalised proper probability mass distribution internally (.e. distribution sums 1). detectability_microscopy_acute, detectability_microscopy_chronic specifies probability parasite detection via microscopy day since entering acute chronic stages. Can vector list. list first element specifies probability distribution first incident disease, second element second incident (final element used remaining incidents). single vector probability distribution used incidents disease. probability distribution, meaning values day can 0 1. detectability_PCR_acute, detectability_PCR_chronic equivalent `detectability_microscopy_acute` `detectability_microscopy_chronic`, detection via polymerase chain reaction (PCR). time_treatment_acute, time_treatment_chronic probability distribution time (days since entering acute chronic stages) requiring treatment. time, host seeks treatment according host-specific treatment seeking parameter (see treatment_seeking_alpha treatment_seeking_beta). Can vector list. list first element specifies probability distribution first incident disease, second element second incident (final element used remaining incidents). single vector probability distribution used incidents disease. Values automatically normalised proper probability mass distribution internally (.e. distribution sums 1). treatment_seeking_mean, treatment_seeking_sd treatment seeking modelled two stages; first, time hosts require treatment drawn probability distribution time_treatment_acute time_treatment_chronic, second, whether go ahead treatment seeking point depends personal host-specific treatment seeking probability. latter probabilities drawn independently host birth Beta distribution mean `treatment_seeking_mean` standard deviation `treatment_seeking_sd`. Hence, parameters describe average propensity seek treatment population, degree inequality treatment seeking. Note `treatment_seeking_sd`` must less `sqrt(treatment_seeking_mean*(1 - treatment_seeking_mean))``, otherwise Beta distribution undefined. duration_prophylactic vector defining probability distribution duration (days) prophylaxis following treatment. infectivity_acute, infectivity_chronic probability onward infectivity mosquitoes day since entering acute chronic states. Can vector list. list first element specifies infectivity first incident disease, second element second incident (final element used remaining incidents). single vector infectivity used episodes disease. max_inoculations maximum number inoculations individual can carry simultaneously. H vector specifying human population size deme. seed_infections vector specifying initial number infected human hosts deme. Infected hosts assumed just bitten, meaning just entered latent phase. M vector specifying mosquito population size (strictly number adult female mosquitoes) deme. mig_mat migration matrix specifying daily probability human migration. source deme given rows, destination deme columns. life_table vector specifying probability death human host one-year age group. Defaults life table taken Mali - see ?life_table_Mali details.

what:
Data on prevalence and incidence broken down by age, used in Griffin et al.
2014 model fit — prev_inc_griffin2014
title:
Data on prevalence and incidence broken down by age, used in Griffin et al.
2014 model fit — prev_inc_griffin2014
text: Data used fit model described Griffin et al. (2010) Griffin et al. (2014). Data consists multiple prevalence incidence estimates, broken age study site. Alongside observation counts (.e. numerator denominator values) data contains estimated distributions EIR treatment rates can used define priors model fitting.

title:
Data on prevalence and incidence broken down by age, used in Griffin et al.
2014 model fit — prev_inc_griffin2014

Data on prevalence and incidence broken down by age, used in Griffin et al.
2014 model fit — prev_inc_griffin2014
text: dataframe 262 rows 16 columns. Columns defined follows: country: country study conducted. reference: original reference data. references can found Griffin et al. (2010) Griffin et al. (2014). site_name: name study site. site_index: unique numerical index given site (sites contained within studies). age0, age1: lower upper ends age group. Brackets open right, example age0 = 1 age1 = 2 corresponds individuals one year age (rather one two year olds). type: whether incidence prevalence estimate. numer, denom: numerator denominator values. prevalence data denominator total population size, incidence data denominator total time risk. case_detection: method case detection, example active case detection (ACD) vs. passive case detection (PCD). meanEIR, sd_hi, sd_low: prior used estimating EIR region. Priors given terms mean lower upper 95 alpha(prop treated), beta(prop treated): shape parameters Beta prior treatment rates population. plot_index: order sites plotted original paper. also order terms posterior EIR. @keywords datasets

title:
Data on prevalence and incidence broken down by age, used in Griffin et al.
2014 model fit — prev_inc_griffin2014
text: @docType data @usage data(prev_inc_griffin2014)

title:
Data on prevalence and incidence broken down by age, used in Griffin et al.
2014 model fit — prev_inc_griffin2014
text: Jamie T. Griffin, Deirdra Hollingsworth, Lucy C. Okell, Thomas S.   Churcher, Michael White, Wes Hinsley, Teun Bousema, Chris J. Drakeley, Neil   M. Ferguson, Maria-Gloria Basanes Azra C. Ghani. Reducing Plasmodium   falciparum Malaria Transmission Africa: Model-Based Evaluation   Intervention Strategies. PLoS Medicine (2010)   doi:10.1371/journal.pmed.1000324   (PubMed) Jamie T. Griffin, Neil M. Ferguson Azra C. Ghani. Estimates   changing age-burden Plasmodium falciparum malaria disease sub-Saharan   Africa. Nature Communications (2014) DOI: 10.1038/ncomms4136   (PubMed)

what: Simulate from simple individual-based model — sim_epi
title: Simulate from simple individual-based model — sim_epi
text: Simulate inbuilt SIMPLEGEN transmission model. Model   parameters taken epi_model_parameters slot   project, sampling strategy taken   epi_sampling_parameters slot. Outputs written   epi_output slot.

title: Simulate from simple individual-based model — sim_epi
code: sim_epi(   project,   max_time = 365,   save_transmission_record = FALSE,   transmission_record_location = "",   overwrite_transmission_record = FALSE,   pb_markdown = FALSE,   silent = FALSE )

title: Simulate from simple individual-based model — sim_epi
text: project SIMPLEGEN project, produced simplegen_project() function. max_time run simulation many days. save_transmission_record whether write transmission record file. transmission_record_location file path transmission record. overwrite_transmission_record TRUE transmission record overwrite existing file name. FALSE default. pb_markdown whether run progress bars markdown mode, meaning updated reach 100 printed markdown files. silent whether suppress written messages console.

text: SIMPLEGEN works using projects, essentially just lists   containing inputs outputs analysis. Often pass   project input output allow modification,   demonstrated examples .
